page.title: 15OWNERSHIP OF THE LINKS
page.content: Golf was originally played on common land. To foil an attempt by the R.& A. to set up a private course, 500 acres of land were purchased from Mr Cheape of Strathyrum by a Private Act of Parliament in 1894. Till the local government reorganisation in 1975, the links were owned by St.Andrews Burgh Council. In 1974 the Links Trust was set up by Act of Parliament to take over responsibility for the courses. There are 8 trustees:the M.P. for North East Fife; 1 nominated by the Secretary of State for Scotland; 3 by the R.& A.;3 by the North East Fife District Council. The management of the courses is in the hands of the Links Management Committee of whom 4 are nominated by the District Council and 4 by the R.& A. They employ 50 full-time greenkeepers with about 10 extra staff in summer.
